name: lower_secondary
label: Lower secondary education (e.g. Middle school, junior high, grades 6–8/9)

name: upper_secondary
label: Upper secondary education (e.g. High school diploma, A-levels, GED, vocational certificate, trade school diploma)

name: postsecondary_non_tertiary
label: Postsecondary non-tertiary education (e.g. Community college certificate, diploma, foundation year)

name: bachelor
label: Bachelor's degree (e.g. BA, BSc, BEng, Bachelor's degree)

name: master
label: Master's degree (e.g. MA, MSc, MEng, MBA, Master's degree)

name: doctorate
label: Doctorate or higher (e.g. PhD, EdD, MD, JD, DPhil, professional doctorate)

name: unemployed_not_looking
label: Unemployed and not looking for work

name: unable_disability
label: Unable to work due to disability/illness

name: few_lines
label: I have written a few lines

name: own_use
label: I have written programs for own use

name: maintained
label: I have written and maintained larger software

name: word_no_code
label: Word processors (e.g., MS Word, Google Docs) without code

name: word_copy_paste
label: Word processors (e.g., MS Word, Google Docs) with copy/paste code output

name: literate_prog
label: Literate programming notebooks (e.g., R Markdown, Quarto, Jupyter)

name: never
label: I have never used an IDE.

name: occasional
label: I have occasionally used an IDE for basic code editing or running scripts.

name: regular
label: I regularly use an IDE for my own projects, taking advantage of features like code completion, debugging, or version control integration.

name: extensive
label: I use IDEs extensively for collaborative development, customizing environments, using advanced features (e.g., remote development, extensions/plugins), and optimizing workflow.

name: never
label: I have never used the command-line interface (Terminal on Mac, Windows Terminal on Windows).

name: occasional
label: I have used the CLI occasionally for basic tasks (e.g. navigating folders, running simple commands).

name: regular
label: I use the CLI regularly for my own projects, including scripting and automating tasks.

name: extensive
label: I use the CLI extensively for advanced workflows, system administration, or integrating with other tools (e.g. SSH, environment management, custom scripts).

name: never
label: I have not used any LLMs.

name: occasional
label: I use LLMs occasionally when needed (e.g once a week).

name: regular
label: I regularly use LLMs to improve efficiency (e.g. once a day).

name: rely
label: I rely on LLMs for completion (e.g. several times a day).

name: unprotected_digital
label: I store them in an unprotected digital file or app (e.g., Word, Excel, email, WhatsApp)

name: paper
label: I write them down on paper
